intro: Vepris glomerata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth vepris, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has smooth, glabrous bark. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. The flowers are clustered in small inflorescences and are followed by small, three-lobed fruits.
